intro: Corylus formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan hazelnut, is a deciduous shrub native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Betulaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and catkin flowers. The plant produces edible nuts enclosed in a cupule, which are a key feature of the Corylus genus. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
